prompt:
Below is a markdown version of a news article from a website. 

    Isolate the article text and article date from the rest of the markdown. 
    Structure this data per the data model shown below in your response.
    Make sure to preserve the parent_monitored_url, article_url, and article_headline exactly as provided.

    # Article Metadata
    parent_monitored_url: https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/teams/manchester-united
    article_url: https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/teams/manchester-united
    article_headline: BBC Manchester United Homepage
    
    # Expected Output Format
    {
        "parent_monitored_url": "{parent_monitored_url}",
        "article_url": "{article_url}",
        "article_headline": "{article_headline}",
        "article_text": "The complete article text including all paragraphs, subheadings, and quotes. Keep all relevant content that could contain quotes.",
        "article_date": "YYYY-MM-DD",
        "publishedTime": "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ" // Optional ISO 8601 timestamp if found
    }

    #Instructions
    1. Extract and clean the main article text:
        • KEEP all article paragraphs, subheadings, and quotes
        • KEEP any text that could contain relevant quotes from people
        • ONLY remove:
          - Navigation menus
          - Advertisements
          - Social media buttons
          - Comments sections
          - Related articles links
          - Copyright notices
          - Cookie/privacy notices
    
    2. For the article date:
        • Extract the article date in YYYY-MM-DD format
        • Use the date provided within the article text, if available.
        • If not found, check the article URL for a potential date.
        • If no date is available in the text or URL, use the current date: 2024-11-30.
        • If you find a full timestamp, include it in publishedTime field.

    #Article Markdown
    event: data
data: {"warning":"Target URL returned error 400: Bad Request","title":"Man Utd - Transfer news, results, fixtures, video and audio","description":"The home of Man Utd on BBC Sport online. Includes the latest news stories, transfers, results, fixtures, video and audio.","url":"https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/teams/manchester-united","content":"Man Utd - Transfer news, results, fixtures, video and audio

1.  ![Image 22: Ruben Amorim Manager of Manchester United during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD5 training and press conference at Carrington Training Ground on November 27, 2024](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/abf0/live/64ff98c0-af33-11ef-bf13-0d5fafac0b95.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    BBC Sport presenter Mark Chapman has been getting to know Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim in an exclusive Football Focus interview, with the Portuguese manager explaining why he appears to be "very relaxed" in his new job.
    
    "I will be OK - no matter what," Amorim said. "In this stage of my life, I will be OK so that's why I am relaxed.
    
    "Everybody says to me: 'This will change me'. This will not change me.
    
    "If something happens, I will be frustrated for a while but I know I will recover. But I believe that we are going to succeed.
    
    "I'm ready. When I had this invitation, I felt that it was really hard to leave my players at Sporting. But, when I had this opportunity, I felt I had to do this \[and make the move\].
    
    "Maybe it is destiny and I will be a little bit lucky in the beginning and then everything is going to be fine."
    
    Watch the full interview with Ruben Amorim on [Football Focus on iPlayer](https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episodes/b006m8tc/football-focus) or listen to the special [Football Daily podcast on BBC Sounds](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k7y4sr)
    
    ![Image 23: Watch on BBC iPlayer banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/bee0/live/08dcdea0-af28-11ef-8ab9-9192db313061.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 24: BBC Sounds banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/974d/live/fe40f530-af27-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.jpg.webp)
    
2.  [Advertisement](https://www.bbc.com/usingthebbc/cookies/)
    
3.  ![Image 25: Ruben Amorim, head coach of Manchester United, during the UEFA Europa League 2024/25 League Phase MD5 match between Manchester United and FK Bodo/Glimt at Old Trafford](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/1a87/live/b06baf40-af26-11ef-907d-d11d58b97d6a.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Ruben Amorim has become the latest manager to be tasked with restoring Manchester United's on-pitch fortunes.
    
    The club paid £11m to Portuguese club Sporting to recruit the 39-year-old and his staff, making him the sixth permanent manager since Sir Alex Ferguson's illustrious 26-year reign ended with his retirement in 2013.
    
    After a draw at Ipswich and a win against Bodo/Glimt in his first two games, his side host Everton on Sunday (13:30 GMT).
    
    BBC Sport presenter Mark Chapman caught up with the Portuguese manager on Football Focus, firstly asking him if he is already feeling a connection with the Manchester United fans.
    
    "Yes for sure, I feel that" Amorim revealed. "Maybe because I'm a little bit of an emotional person. I can transmit that, even in interviews, I think.
    
    "Maybe because I am different from the last coach and this can bring a different connection with the next guy.
    
    "I believe that I am the right guy. People always believe the next guy is the right guy. We always have this feeling.
    
    "To maintain this feeling, we have to play better and win games and be really honest with the supporters.
    
    "If you are honest and direct with the supporters - maybe you don't always say the popular thing - you can create a better connection."
    
    Watch the full interview with Ruben Amorim on [Football Focus on iPlayer](https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episodes/b006m8tc/football-focus) or listen to the special [Football Daily podcast on BBC Sounds](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k7y4sr)

6.  [### 18:36 29 NovemberMan Utd job will change my life... not me - Amorim. Video, 00:03:13, published at 18:36 29 NovemberMan Utd job will change my life... not me - Amorim](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/videos/c62lp2ky9lvo)
    
    *   Attribution
        
        [Man Utd](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/teams/manchester-united)
        
    
    3:13
    
    ![Image 28: Ruben Amorim](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/a5a6/live/468b4f00-ae7b-11ef-93a6-9fd2d3586a96.jpg)
    
7.  ![Image 30: Mason Mount warms up before a Manchester United match](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/eca4/live/2bd50e50-ae29-11ef-be95-a1f725d18284.jpg.webp)Image source, PA Media
    
    Mason Mount is a "proper footballer" who wants to succeed at Manchester United, says head coach Ruben Amorim.
    
    Mount, 25, joined from [Chelsea](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea) in the summer of 2023 but his time at Old Trafford so far has been hampered by injury issues.
    
    He started against Bodo/Glimt and played for an hour of Thursday's Europa League victory.
    
    Amorim talked about his "belief" in Mount and said of the England midfielder: "The first thing is he's working really hard. Then you have to understand the human also - he wants this really badly, and that is the most important thing.
    
    "He has proved he is a really talented player. He was a European champion, so we believe in him a lot.
    
    "He has to stay fit and, like all the guys in the team, they are quality players, they have to improve and believe in themselves.
    
    "On Thursday he did a great job. You see some moments and details where you can see that Mason is a proper footballer. We believe in him a lot and I especially believe a lot in Mason."
    
    After a draw at [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) in his first game in charge, Amorim is hopeful of a first Premier League win as United boss against [Everton](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/everton) on Sunday (13:30 GMT).
    
    "It's going to be a different match with a lot of fighting for long balls and second balls," he added.
    
    "They have a quality coach who understands the league and understands the moment of the opponent. We need to have the ball because we have a short time to recover.
    
    "I hope for a win and I hope to see different things in my team improve, like we did from Ipswich to now, against Everton, without training. I expect to see different things and better things."
    
    [Follow all of Friday's Premier League news conferences and the rest of the day's football news](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/live/cy0gx81v9wlt)
    
    ![Image 31: An image detailing how to follow your Premier League team on BBC Sport: "On the app? Tap the bell icon to get news about your club sent to you. Signed in on a browser? Hit 'Follow' to stay up to date.](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/3a8e/live/3f0326b0-08a2-11ef-b9d8-4f52aebe147d.jpg.webp)
    
8.  ![Image 32: Amad Diallo with his head in his hands](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/b063/live/4fda0020-ae48-11ef-bba4-9b564b9d9e3d.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Manchester United have scored 13 goals from an xG of 18.3 in the Premier League this term, netting about five goals fewer than the quality of their chances suggests they should have. No team is underperforming compared to their xG more than the Red Devils.
    
9.  [### 08:37 29 NovemberSupport from Man Utd fans 'really special' - Amorim. Video, 00:01:09, published at 08:37 29 NovemberSupport from Man Utd fans 'really special' - Amorim](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/videos/c4g2n5k74ryo)
    
    *   Attribution
        
        [Man Utd](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/teams/manchester-united)
        
    
    1:09
    
    ![Image 33: Ruben Amorim](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/2dcc/live/941ef150-ae2a-11ef-8ab9-9192db313061.jpg)
    
10.  ![Image 35: Your views banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/2f7f/live/95709000-0915-11ef-bee9-6125e244a4cd.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 36: i sport page and Telegraph sport page](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/a5e5/live/b450da90-ae27-11ef-8ab9-9192db313061.png.webp)
    
    We asked for your thoughts after Thursday's Europa League game between Manchester United and Bodo/Glimt.
    
    Here are some of your comments:
    
    **Mike:** It's still early days and improvements are needed, but we are seeing fluid and attacking football return. Garnacho can't cross or shoot. Bodo/Glimt should wrap up their second successive domestic title at the weekend - they would have destroyed an Erik ten Hag team, so they are no walkover! Great possession in positions where it mattered and 20 shots! Hojlund was great.
    
    **Adam:** Taking the lead so early and then throwing it away to go 2-1 down so soon after just shows the frailty of the new system. We were exposed too often but, thankfully, they weren't the strongest of teams so we got off lightly. The major positive of the night has to be Hojlund. He is showing that if you feed him properly, he will do the rest!
    
    **Amogh:** Ruben Amorim showed he is decisive with substitutions and tactically flexible. My worry is that he doesn't have the players to play the system that he wants to play, and that means people playing out of position and not to their strengths. You can get away with that against a mid-table team, but not against a top eight team in the Premier League.
    
    **Brendan:** Ugarte is the glue that keeps this team together. He is a similar player to Roy Keane - impressive. Malacia had so much ball but he was not able to cope with or penetrate the defence. Shaw was dependable as usual. Rashford, regretfully, is a total lost cause and he needs to move on.
    
    **Alex:** Positive signs, definitely, but we have to make sure we don't get too excited. The great thing is that we are starting to see an identity within this team, which we haven't seen in a very long time. I'm very interested to see where we go from here and what our optimal line-up will be.
    
    ![Image 37: An image detailing how to follow your Premier League team on BBC Sport: "On the app? Tap the bell icon to get news about your club sent to you. Signed in on a browser? Hit 'Follow' to stay up to date.](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/51a6/live/913754d0-476b-11ef-96a8-e710c6bfc866.jpg.webp)
    
11.  ![Image 38: Gossip graphic](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/c043/live/ecb3f520-0913-11ef-82e8-cd354766a224.png.webp)
    
    Manchester United are lining up a £50m move to rival [Chelsea](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea) for 22-year-old Benfica and Portugal central defender Tomas Araujo in January. [(Sun), external](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31991935/man-utd-tomas-araujo-transfer-benfica-ruben-amorim/)
    
    Sporting and Sweden forward Viktor Gyokeres is keen on following former boss Ruben Amorim to Old Trafford, dealing a blow to [Arsenal](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/arsenal)'s pursuit of the 26-year-old. [(Football.London), external](https://www.football.london/arsenal-fc/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-delivers-arsenal-blow-30474165)
    
    Meanwhile, Manchester United and [Manchester City](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-city) have been offered the opportunity to buy 26-year-old Brazil midfielder Douglas Luiz and 23-year-old Italy midfielder Nicolo Fagioli from Juventus. [(Gazzetta dello Sport - in Italian), external](https://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Juventus/28-11-2024/mercato-juve-chi-arriva-se-partono-fagioli-e-douglas-luiz.shtml?refresh_ce)
    
    [Want more transfer news? Read Friday's full gossip column](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/czj7r4vzwl0o)
    
12.  [### 00:06 29 NovemberAmorim enjoys 'special' first Man Utd win despite 'anxiety', published at 00:06 29 NovemberAmorim enjoys 'special' first Man Utd win despite 'anxiety'](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/c5yg10nxgd1o)
    
    *   Attribution
        
        [Man Utd](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/teams/manchester-united)
        
    
    *   Comments
        
        [780](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/c5yg10nxgd1o#comments)
        
    
    ![Image 39: Ruben Amorim](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/c6a9/live/473de420-ade1-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.jpg)
    
13.  ![Image 41: Ruben Amorim applauds the fans](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/7ab9/live/71841f00-add8-11ef-a053-3198324bb252.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim, speaking to TNT Sports**: "Of course, I see what what everybody sees, good moments, difficult moments.
    
    "There was some confusion in the end trying to hold the result, but the lads did a great job. They ran, they pressed, they tried to do the things we have worked on in the last three days and we won!
    
    "Half of the stadium doesn't know me. I came from Portugal and I did nothing for this club. Yet, the way they make me feel at home is special.
    
    "I will keep this to the end of my career."
    
    **On the game:** "Like a real ride. We started well, but then suffered two goals in two transitions. I like the way the players tried to play our game.
    
    "Sometimes we won the ball and have had problems in the past giving the ball away too much - the mindset is keeping the ball.
    
    "They are really trying and I think we deserved the win."
    
14.  ![Image 42: Rasmus Hojlund scores](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/a395/live/88f5d1c0-add7-11ef-a053-3198324bb252.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Twenty-one-year-old Rasmus Hojlund has scored eight major European goals for Manchester United - the only players to score more aged 21 or younger for the club are Marcus Rashford and Wayne Rooney (nine each).
    
15.  ![Image 43: Rasmus Hojlund scores Manchester United's third goal](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/9ea4/live/1e53ff90-add7-11ef-a053-3198324bb252.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **Manchester United double goalscorer Rasmus Hojlund to TNT Sports:** "It was a little bit of a bad start but we came back and showed character. We want to make sure these games don't get too exciting. But it's all about the three points."
    
    **On Ruben Amorim encouraging a high press:** "He told me not to think too much about the guys behind me and just work on what I can see in front of me. We saw that with the first goal.
    
    "Obviously it's going to take time \[to adjust to his style\] but we can already see some patterns. Now it's time for us to build. For me this system reminds me of how I played in a 3-4-3 at Atalanta. It suits me well."
    
16.  ![Image 44: Alejandro Garnacho scores](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/5f1d/live/b4c603d0-add5-11ef-a053-3198324bb252.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    In Manchester United's first two games under Ruben Amorim, they have opened the scoring in 81 seconds at [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) and in 48 seconds against Bodo/Glimt.
    
    Alejandro Garnacho's tap-in, is the first time United have scored in the opening minute of a major European game since March 1991, when Brian McClair opened the scoring against Montpellier in a Uefa Cup Winners' Cup.
    
17.  [### 22:08 28 NovemberMan Utd recover to beat Bodo/Glimt for Amorim's first win, published at 22:08 28 NovemberMan Utd recover to beat Bodo/Glimt for Amorim's first win](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/live/c704de3gjkkt)
    
    *   Attribution

Hit 'Follow' to stay up to date.](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/cd24/live/fd57cc70-816e-11ef-ad45-893aa022fcbc.jpg.webp)
    
    Eighteen matches make up Thursday's Europa League schedule, with Manchester United and Tottenham Hotspur both in action.
    
    *   Manchester United v Bodo/Glimt
        
    *   Tottenham Hotspur v Roma
        
    
    _Both games kick off at 20:00 GMT_
    
    [See all of Thursday's Europa League fixtures here](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/scores-fixtures/2024-11-28)

20.  **Simon Stone**  
    Chief football news reporter
    
    ![Image 50: Bodo/Glimt supporters wave scarves](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/0baa/live/ed0e8020-acc5-11ef-8c4f-d52b39c994e1.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt flew into Manchester on Wednesday before the Europa League match with Manchester United at Old Trafford.
    
    While Glimt are currently establishing themselves as Norway's top team, that has not always been the case.
    
    Sporting director Havard Sakariassen used to be a player at the club and he remembered a period where the squad had to wash their own kit.
    
    "If you go back to the year in 2009-2011, the club was struggling really hard financially," he said.
    
    "I had my last season in 2011 as a player. In mid-season that year I quit. I was old and not any good. I left the changing room and went upstairs.
    
    "At that time the club was in such bad conditions that we didn't have a kit manager. We washed our training gear at home and came to training already dressed. That was the situation at Bodo/Glimt in 2011.
    
    "We had one person working for the A team that autumn. That was me. I was the kit man."
    
    Even though the Norwegian champions accept they can never come close to matching the financial muscle Premier League clubs receive, they do not travel to Manchester without belief of causing a shock.
    
    "We don't have the resources you see at top clubs in England," Sakariassen added. "We will never, ever be able to compete with that.
    
    "But we truly believe in development and that we can get the potential out of the players we have here. If we can do that, as individuals and as a team, it is huge. Then you can make a great team and it goes a long way.
    
    "Maybe I am naive. But in a single match like on Thursday, I think we will be able to compete against Manchester United and have a great performance at Old Trafford."
    
21.  ![Image 51: Fara Williams, BBC Sport columnist banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/28f5/live/41e249b0-6e9b-11ef-b282-4535eb84fe4b.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 52: Marcus Rashford looks down during match](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/6ca1/live/9deedbb0-accb-11ef-9567-e3ed3a4de1fc.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    The Ruben Amorim system can definitely work for Marcus Rashford but he is going to have to change his mentality.
    
    From the outside, you try to read body language and, while we may not always read it correctly, Rashford does not look happy.
    
    Look at the 3-4-3 system, the only position I think he can fit into is the number nine role that he played in at the weekend. That means in terms of his mentality, and maybe his attitude, a little bit is going to have to change.
    
    Once he got his goal against [Ipswich](http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town), he seemed to settle for it but when you look at how Amorim’s Sporting team's worked with and without the ball, that is something Rashford is will have learn he has to do. It is down to him as an individual to adapt.
    
    But it is sad. As an outsider looking in, it is sad to see him looking miserable and not looking like he is enjoying playing. When you feel that way you really do not get the best out of yourself.
    
    I have been there when you are at a club and you do not feel like you want to be there. It is really difficult to pick yourself up and carry on and he seems to be in that moment at United. Maybe it is time for him to move on to get back to his best because unless he changes his mentality a little bit and Amorim can get him working, then I do not see a place for him in the team.
    
    The manager will certainly want him to play. We know Rashford is a quality player on his day, we know what he can do and it is about getting him back to being the player that he can be.
    
    _Fara Williams was speaking to BBC Sport's Nicola Pearson_

22.  [### 09:03 28 NovemberVote for Joao Pedro as captain - FPL tips and team of the week, published at 09:03 28 NovemberVote for Joao Pedro as captain - FPL tips and team of the week](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/c704p9xjlz1o)
    
    *   Attribution

    *   Comments
        
        [45](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/c704p9xjlz1o#comments)
        
    
    ![Image 54: BBC sport FPL team of the week graphic](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/1737/live/d218a720-acaf-11ef-a4fe-a3e9a6c5d640.png)
    
23.  **Simon Stone**  
    Chief football news reporter
    
    ![Image 56: Man Utd expert view](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/2f1e/live/21c02180-ad60-11ef-8ab9-9192db313061.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 57: Sir Jim Ratcliffe](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/a0aa/live/14a49210-ad60-11ef-bef0-930d33fc9c2e.jpg.webp)Image source, PA Media
    
    These are tricky times on and off the pitch at Manchester United as the club tries to reset itself.
    
    After the discontent around the Glazer regime, most fans welcomed Sir Jim Ratcliffe's arrival as co-owner with open arms.
    
    However, the veneer is beginning to wear off and news around Old Trafford in the past 48 hours has shone a spotlight on the club in a way that is not positive for the new regime.
    
    It has long been decided more needs to be sweat out of the club to generate more income to spend on the first team.
    
    Part of this came through a mass redundancy programme, in which many long-serving and popular figures at the club - some of whom were lifelong fans - have lost their jobs.
    
    Then this week, it has been confirmed matchday prices are going up to £66, with no concessions, for tickets not already sold.
    
    At the same time, United have also revealed the cost of sacking Erik ten Hag and bringing in Ruben Amorim as head coach is in excess of £21m.
    
    The argument will clearly be that instead of targeting 'normal' workers and fans, Ratcliffe and co need to be sorting out United's terrible recruitment - which now includes their decisions given the choice to keep Ten Hag after the FA Cup final victory went wrong.
    
    It is not as linear as that obviously. But at any Premier League club, costs associated with the first-team far outweigh anything else.
    
    Getting recruitment right is imperative.
    
    ![Image 58: An image detailing how to follow your Premier League team on BBC Sport: "On the app? Tap the bell icon to get news about your club sent to you. Signed in on a browser? Hit 'Follow' to stay up to date.
    ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/68d2/live/7ba63310-ad60-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.jpg.webp)
    
24.  ![Image 59: Gossip graphic](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/c043/live/ecb3f520-0913-11ef-82e8-cd354766a224.png.webp)
    
    [Bournemouth](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/afc-bournemouth)'s 21-year-old Hungary defender Milos Kerkez is drawing attention from Manchester United and [Liverpool](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool). [(Sky Germany via Florian Plettenberg), external](https://x.com/Plettigoal/status/1861760891936449004)
    
    Meanwhile, United have made a shortlist of three more left-backs, including 27-year-old [Chelsea](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea) and England international Ben Chilwell, 23-year-old [Wolves](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/wolverhampton-wanderers) and Algeria international Rayan Ait-Nouri, and Benfica's 21-year-old Spaniard Alvaro Carreras. [(Rudy Galetti), external](https://x.com/RudyGaletti/status/1861758728581550515)
    
    Finally, United, [Manchester City](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-city) and [Liverpool](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool) are all keen on Atalanta midfielder Ederson, but it will take a monster offer to sign the 25-year-old. [(Teamtalk), external](https://www.teamtalk.com/news/man-utd-man-city-driving-seat-liverpool-target-monster-transfer-demand-emerges)
